7e6bb08e-10e8-4d8e-924e-7dc41a5cba18.description: This badge signifies that the recipient contributed to the development of the Bridgewater State University Civics Education micro-credential program. This program offers professional development for K-12 Educators centered on the Civics Education component of the Massachusetts History and Social Science Framework.
7e6bb08e-10e8-4d8e-924e-7dc41a5cba18.name: BSU Civics Education Team

badge_template_activities.title: Participation in the development of the Bridgewater State University Civics Education micro-credential program.

ab3dcf3b-e6bf-42f6-a4a3-4c2a97290579.description: The Massachusetts Chronicles is a new approach for teaching and learning state history developed in conjunction with Plymouth 400, Bridgewater State University and range of other prestigious partners. The program is focused around a set of key resources that include a book, with more than 60 newspaper-style articles of key moments and a 100-moment timeline, and a cross-curricular educator’s guide containing a wide range of classroom activities for Grades 5 -12.
ab3dcf3b-e6bf-42f6-a4a3-4c2a97290579.name: Teaching State and Local History with The Massachusetts Chronicles

alignments.name: MA History & Social Science Practice Standards (pp. 23-25)
alignments.description: Designed for integration with the Content Standards and Literacy Standards for History and Social Science, the seven practices encompass the processes of inquiry and research that are integral to a rich and robust social science curriculum and the foundation for active and responsible citizenship.

badge_template_activities.title: Utilized content from The Massachusetts Chronicles to engage their students in active learning. See website for complete requirements:

e239e159-d180-4d1a-93b2-bbf6c43506d5.description: This training is designed to deepen the professional development of early educators on the topics of trauma competency, culturally responsive teaching practices and RMK’s Civics, Advocacy and Justice principles. Educators completing Tier 1: Ally credentialing will gain a greater understanding of how to implement their Diversity, Equity and Inclusion (DEI) knowledge into lesson development.
e239e159-d180-4d1a-93b2-bbf6c43506d5.name: Raising Multiculturally Kids in the Classroom (Pre K-6th Grade)

alignments.name: MA DESE Professional Standards for Teachers, Standard 2: Teaching all students
alignments.description: The teacher promotes the learning and growth of all students through instructional practices that establish high expectations, create a safe and effective classroom environment, and demonstrate cultural proficiency.

badge_template_activities.title: Micro-credential completion requires teachers to submit a contextual narrative, modified lesson plan and a reflection on its implementation. Completion of these requirements will result in an additional 10 PDP’s to the 7 PDP’s gained from the day of training.
